intro: [WRONG START] Hieracussion subanfractum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and disturbed soils, preferring temperate climates. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
